-Remove .tool-versions file (if exists) to avoid mise usage.
-Create runtime.txt with exact Python version:
python-3.12.11

-Create Procfile with the command to run your app:
web: gunicorn your_project_name.wsgi::application --bind 0.0.0.0:$PORT

-Generate requirements.txt listing all needed packages:
pip freeze > requirements.txt

-Run fly launch locally inside your project folder:
Choose NO Dockerfile when prompted.
Set app name (should match GitHub repo if connected).
This creates fly.toml.
Commit and push fly.toml to your GitHub repo (if using GitHub integration).

-From local: run
fly deploy
fly deploy --local-only




-Fix GitHub Secret Setting Issues
If Fly CLI can’t set FLY_API_TOKEN secret automatically:
Manually add FLY_API_TOKEN in your GitHub repo’s Secrets.
Add other Django secrets (like SECRET_KEY, DATABASE_URL) as Fly secrets via CLI or dashboard:
fly secrets set SECRET_KEY=your_secret DATABASE_URL=your_db_url
